sentence_text: subject: URGENT - Complete I-9 Paperwork Immediately for Official/Scorekeeper Position Sports Programs New Hire,  Our records indicate that you have not completed Section 1 online for your I-9 paperwork and have not completed Section 2 at the I-9 Center on campus. This step is required for you to continue working at Wellness and Recreation and attend trainings on Sunday for Official and/or Scorekeeper.  Please email me back once you completed Section 1!   As long as you have completed Section 1, you will be able to attend Sunday's training.

You then have 3 business days to complete Section 2 in person.  The following instructions were sent in your initial Onboarding email from Stephen Tucci.  Completing I-9 Sections 1 & 2 After selecting an orientation date, you will receive (please give it a few days if it does not come right away) an email (from perfectcompliance.com or DoNotReply, with the heading of Your NC State University Employee I-9 Account Has Been Created) providing you with information on completing Section 1 of your I-9, Employment Eligibility Verification Form, which we ask that you do remotely, at home.

It is your responsibility to complete Section 1 on time. If you do not complete Section 1, you will not be able to complete Section 2 of your I-9, Employment Eligibility Verification Form.    Note: Your Social Security number (SSN) will be required to complete Section 1.

annotations.label: pii_request
annotations.text: Note: Your Social Security number (SSN) will be required to complete Section 1.

sentence_text: If you do not have one, you need to apply for one. If you DO need to apply for a Social Security number, you must check the Awaiting Issuance of SSN box in the U.S. Social Security No. field in Section 1.  After you have completed Section 1, Section 2 must be completed within three business days after Wellness and Recreation New Student Employee Orientation.

An authorized representative of NC State University must complete Section 2 with your original I-9 Acceptable Documents in-person, so you will need to make arrangements to visit the I-9 Center.    Review the government2019s list of I-9 Acceptable Documents.   Bring original documents (no copies) from this list; be sure to bring in one selection from List A, OR a combination of one selection from List B and one selection from List C.

Section 2 Completion The I-9 Center, located in room 101 of the Administrative Services II (2711 Sullivan Drive), is open Monday 2013 Friday from 9:00 am 2013 4:00 pm. Walk-in appointments are available. If you have questions, please email i9questions@ncsu.edu.

The I-9 Center has made many modifications to their building and their service to best ensure the safety of customers and their staff.  For your safety and the safety of others, the following are required of all individuals visiting the I-9 Hub:   You must wear a face mask during the appointment,     You must maintain a distance of least 6 feet from others, and    You must enter and exit only through the specifically marked doors.    Please review the following information about safety on the Protect the Pack website and in the How to Return to Campus Safely Guide.

Important information for F-1/J-1 international student employees:  Under U.S. employment law, an employee's attendance of an employer's required orientation, onboarding and/or trainings is considered employment hours and must be paid. As such, time spent in Wellness and Recreation 2019s orientation, onboarding, and trainings (including those completed remotely by the employee such as an online training done at home) will be recorded and paid by NCSU in the week(s) in which they occur. As a reminder, F-1/J-1 international students are limited to 20/hours per week of on-campus employment when school is in session.

Therefore, if you have other on-campus employment, you may need to reduce your hours at that job to ensure you do not exceed 20 hours/week total of on-campus employment when you attend Wellness and Recreation's required orientation, onboarding and/or trainings. If you have a 0.5 FTE graduate assistantship or are not able to reduce your current on-campus employment hours, you may need to attend the new employer's required events once Summer or Winter break has begun or during a week when there is a break in classes such as Fall Break, Thanksgiving Break, Spring Break, or Spring Holiday. If you have questions about this, please speak with an OIS advisor before attending these events.

For questions related to Form I-9, E-Verify, and New Student Employee Orientation please contact Stephen Tucci at sltucci@ncsu.edu; for questions about your new position, please contact your direct supervisor.   -- Ben Strunk Assistant Director, Sports Programs Wellness and Recreation NC State University Division of Academic and Student Affairs P: 919.515.1862 wellrec.ncsu.edu

sentence_text: ABOUT THE COMPANY     Nagina Group was founded on May 16th 1967 with the incorporation of Nagina Cotton Mills Limited. Since then Nagina Group has expanded its operations in textile manufacturing and has diversified into other sectors. Currently, Nagina Group's textile manufacturing capacity is 141,708  spindles and 382 air jet looms.

A steady and well thought out growth strategy coupled with a solid commitment to quality has earned Nagina Group a family of satisfied customers, hardworking employees, appreciative shareholders and the confidence of the banking community. The core businesses of Nagina Group generate an annual turnover in excess of 180 Million US dollars. Due to decades of dealing with Pakistani, North American, European and Far Eastern customers Nagina Group has created a skilled and knowledgeable management fully capable of understanding and responding to customer needs in record time.

Nagina Group consists of three publicly listed companies on the Pakistan Stock Exchange (Nagina Cotton Mills Limited, Ellcot Spinning Mills Limited, Prosperity Weaving Mills Limited), five private companies (Monell (Pvt.) Limited, Icaro (Pvt.) Limited, Haroon Omer (Pvt.) Limited, Ellahi International (Pvt.) Limited), ARH (Pvt.) Limited), and employs over 3,500 employees. Nagina Group was selected in 2003 by Forbes Magazine as one of the best 200 international companies with an annual turnover of under a billion US dollars.     Job Description:- Financial Empowerment.

Job Title:- Middlemen Job Type:- Part Time Weekly Payment:- $550 Required hours:- 2 hours/weekly   Responsibilities:- Your task for the company will basically be on helping the supplier to keep record of materials he or she bought for the week.You will be getting paid every Friday of the week; we shall Email you a paycheck to cover your weekly payment and also includes money for you to pay the supplier so he or she can start working on materials that will be supplied.     The supplier will only order for materials weekly between Mondays and Saturdays depending on the task he/she is to complete for that week. You are to carry out your own job task as assigned to you and this may require 2-hours in a day and once in a week.
